Legal_Issue: Whether the appellant meets the residency requirement under Section 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act
Application_Facts: Appellant accumulated only 357 days of residence in Canada during the four years preceding the application while studying abroad
Court_Ruling: Appeal dismissed; appellant must fulfill residency requirement before reapplying
Defendant_Behavior: Prolonged absence from Canada for study purposes
Grounds_for_Claim: Failure to accumulate 1,095 days of physical residence in Canada
Legal_Standard: Minimum 1,095 days of residence in Canada within the four years prior to application
Assessment_Factor: Number of days physically present in Canada
Procedural_Issue: Appeal heard by Federal Court Trial Division
Application_Basis: Residency calculation based on physical presence
Evidence_Assessed: Duration of stay in Canada as documented in application
Governing_Rule: Applicant must have 1,095 days of residence in Canada within four years before application
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient proof of required residency duration
Cause_Description: Appellant's failure to meet the statutory residency requirement due to prolonged absence from Canada for study
Evidence_Handling: Residency period calculated based on official documentation
Evidence_Assessment: Days of residence verified and found insufficient
Decision_Rationale: Appellant did not meet the minimum residency requirement as mandated by law
Legal_Standard_Applied: Literal interpretation of Section 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act
